page.title: 09DUNBAR SEA CADETS
page.content: {History}- this unit was formed in 1959 and named after the destroyer 'Valient' (now a nuclear submarine).The unit was recommissioned in 1980. {A typical meeting}We wear a uniform which consists of flared trousers, tunic,silk ribbon lanyard, white front, jumper and cap. The meeting begins when we hoist the flags and this is followed by classes in communications, seamanship, or electrical engineering. We have a refreshment break called 'stand easy'. This is followed by discussions on boatwork or firefighting. The meeting may end with a game of deck hockey which is played with a piece of rope instead of a ball. Cadets can often be sent to other naval bases on courses to improve their skills.(Kevin Brunton)
